Name: Spring Adventures
Description: Bing'ge has been scorched for his work recently. He needs someone who can help.
QuestDesc: Bing'ge has been scorched for his work recently. He needs someone who can help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello there.

Options.PlotLineKey: It appears you've been busy lately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. With Hongzhen back to normal, we've been swamped here at the gate... I never thought life here could get this busy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, {PlayerName}, have you come to help us?

Options.PlotLineKey: Is there something I can help with?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! In fact, there’s a job that would be just right for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are a few hot springs around Hongzhen. Ordinarily, we monitor the water periodically to check for contamination from Tacet Discords or the like.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as you can see, we've been short on manpower lately. Inspections were due days ago, but we haven't had anyone available to send...

Options.PlotLineKey: Does inspection require special equipment?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Equipment? No, no, no, we don't bother with that sort of thing here. Here in Hongzhen, we rely on the Pavo Plums by the hot springs to check the water, just as our ancestors did.

Options.PlotLineKey: Pavo Plums...?
How... how do you use them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Pavo Plum plant is highly sensitive to its environment. It absorbs harmful substances from its surroundings, leading to slight changes in its appearance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Basically, I just give the Pavo Plum a good whiff, check its hue, and give it a quick lick. That’ll tell me all I need to know about the water's quality.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you serious?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, don't give me that look!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm as local as it gets! Ever since I—no, ever since my Grandpa was a baby, we've always done it this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, there are three hot springs needing inspection, and they're just a stone's throw away. I'm counting on you, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fish... There are fish in the hot spring!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The water is so hot. Wouldn't it cook the fish?

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! I get it! They are jumping out of the water because it's too hot!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, do you know what's happening here?

Options.PlotLineKey: These fish are Airsailers. They can handle the heat.
Uh... I guess... what you said is right!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... so that's the reason. Awesome! Thanks for teaching me this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! So the teacher was right! When in doubt, think it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These fish... Oh, I just know the teacher will be thrilled if I write about them! Yep, it’s diary time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hongzhen is full of fun things to do... Where should I go next?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is my analysis. Hmm... It lacks adequate theoretical support and empirical validation, but I am resolved to... maintain my stance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Save it, please. This is art. Creation. It defies the cold logic of mere numbers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyways, what's your choice?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Corn!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Egg!

Options.PlotLineKey: What is this about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... it's {PlayerName}! You have perfect timing. We were just discussing which foods taste better when cooked in hot spring water.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust me, I've been around. When it comes to cooking things in a hot spring, your first thought would be an egg, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I beg to differ. An egg has a shell! Boiling it in a hot spring is no different than boiling it in regular water.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Corn, however, can really absorb all the good stuff from the hot spring. But eggs? ZERO ABSORPTION!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Like I said, cuisine is an art, not a science!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who likes plain old boiled eggs anyway?!

Options.PlotLineKey: This is what you're arguing about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're at a stalemate here, so it's up to you—yes, you! Which food do you think tastes better when cooked in a hot spring?

Options.PlotLineKey: Eggs?
Corn?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, even {PlayerName} agrees. Eggs boiled in hot springs are the best! That's what I call art!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, just as I expected. {PlayerName} always makes judgments with wisdom and reason.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At this moment, an elderly man shuffles over unsteadily.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I could hear you quarreling from a mile away... Cough, none of you are from Hongzhen, are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This spring's barely warmer than body heat. It's not even good for a hot bath, let alone boiling food in it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is... is that so?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How embarrassing... We should have inspected the hot spring first before our discussion...

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it's spring fare you're after, make your way to Spring's Taste.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've got a spring nearly boiling over—perfect for cooking up local specialties. It's a well-known delight in Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That water’s hot enough to perfectly steam a chicken, let alone eggs or corn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Employee
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My mouth is already beginning to water!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case, should we go take a look later?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at that! Finally, an unguarded hot spring!

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We traveled so far and endured so much, all... all for this moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boss...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You feel it, don't you? Our hard work paid off! Ah, and that faint scent of sulfur... Just standing here is already washing away all the exhaustion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Um... It's not that. Boss, I'm trying to say...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does that person over there... look familiar?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... it's that... What were they calling {Male=him;Female=her}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! They were with that little monk outside Jinzhou! How did {Male=he;Female=she} manage to follow us here... Oh no, did they find out what we did in Jinzhou...

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That seems a bit much, doesn't it? Just lifted a few fish... from the cages, no less! And we did replace them with worms later, didn't we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, that monk... She isn't here, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don’t see her. Looks like the Rover is alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alone...? {Male=He;Female=She}'s thumbing {Male=his;Female=her} nose at us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is our chance. Grab your weapon, boy! Time for revenge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spare us, please! We surrender, we surrender!

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How was that even possible? We had the numbers...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you here for the hot springs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. We pulled off a mission just days ago, now today we need to—

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: —That's right! We heard that the hot springs in Hongzhen were the best, so we left Jinzhou looking for them. We've been behaving ourselves perfectly all the way, I swear!

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive us, we didn't know you were in charge of this hot spring. It's just, we weren't allowed in Hongzhen, so we had to—

Options.PlotLineKey: "Pull off a mission"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, no! That’s not it, you see, what I meant was... We couldn't pay the admission! Yes, we couldn't pay the admission fee to the hot spring!

Options.PlotLineKey: Really...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really. Ever since the day when you and that monk showed us a better way, we've been reforming our ways. We even helped Lollo Logistics to deliver goods the other day!

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... Well, this was all just a misunderstanding. Let's skedaddle, shall we?

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't let me catch you a third time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You got it. From here on out, we'll be model citizens, contributing positively to society.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The exiles leave in a hurry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, I've gathered all the Pavo Plums Bing'ge requested.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll head back to town now to deliver them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you're back. Did everything go well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time for a little inspection... Hmm, color checks out. And the smell... all good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, onto the taste... Mmm... Yup, spot on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The zesty bitterness hits the spot. Seems like these hot springs are clean. Whew, I can finally breathe easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, happen to see anything interesting along the way?

Options.PlotLineKey: Flying fish in a hot spring?
Two people arguing about eggs and corn?
Exiles hoping for a soak?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What in the world... Ha, that's got to be one heck of a story!

Options.PlotLineKey: You can say that again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm on duty now. Ugh, should've skipped work to see it myself. This endless grind is driving me crazy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, thanks for the help, {PlayerName}. Until next time!
